Page         PREAMBLE Essential medicines satisfy priority healthcare needs majority population . essential medicines list needs country specific addressing disease burden nation commonly used medicines primary , secondary tertiary healthcare levels . medicines National List Essential Medicines ( NLEM ) available affordable costs assured quality . medicines used various national health programmes , emerging reemerging infections addressed list . Government India , Ministry Health & Family Welfare ( MOHFW ) mandated ensure quality healthcare system assuring availability safe efficacious medicines population . primary purpose NLEM promote rational use medicines considering three important aspects i.e . cost , safety efficacy . Furthermore promotes prescription generic names . Healthcare delivery institutions , health insurance bodies , standards setting institutions medicines , medicine price control bodies , health economists healthcare stakeholders immensely benefitted framing policies . Page         NLEM      prepared several rounds wide consultations experts different disciplines different parts country various organizations . NLEM dynamic document feedback stakeholders welcome help revision regular basis . core committee NLEM      would like place record appreciation subject experts made significant contribution revision updating list essential medicines India . Page               EXECUTIVE SUMMARY National list essential medicines one key instruments balanced healthcare delivery system country inter alia includes accessible , affordable quality medicine primary , secondary , tertiary levels healthcare . Realizing GOI , MOHFW decided essential medicines list . first National List Essential Medicines India prepared released      . list subsequently revised      . address issues changing disease prevalence , treatment modalities , introduction newer medicines identification unacceptable risk-benefit profile well therapeutic profile medicines , GOI , MOHFW considered need updating NLEM . Revision NLEM also based two important national reference documents i.e. , Indian Pharmacopeia      National Formulary India ,  th Edition ,      . former deals standards identity , purity strength medicines later provides information rational use medicines particularly healthcare professionals . K. Gupta , Professor & Head , Department Pharmacology , AIIMS , New Delhi unanimously nominated chairman Committee . meeting core committee informed CDSCO already taken initiative direction organized workshop entitled “ Expert Group Meeting Revision Updating National List Essential Medicines ” September    ,      collaboration Department Pharmacology , AIIMS India Office . workshop attended representatives following : CDSCO , Ministry Health ; ; India Institute Medical Sciences , New Delhi ; Indian Pharmacopoeia Commission ; Indian Council Medical Research experts different disciplines leading medical pharmacy institutions country . issue updating NLEM also deliberated dedicated session Annual Conference Indian Pharmacological Society , December      Page        Kolkata session chaired Prof. K Gupta , AIIMS Dr. K Weerasuriya , WHO-SEARO . core committee took note proceedings two meetings revising NLEM . core committee meeting deliberated although prepared updated list “ Essential Medicines ” , adopted . NLEM India country specific considering disease prevalence , cost effectiveness Medicines etc country . meeting criteria inclusion/ deletion medicines developed road map revision updating NLEM ,      drawn . Sh . V. K. Tyagi Department Pharmaceuticals ( DoP ) , Ministry Chemicals & Fertilizers emphasized importance NLEM view directions Hon ’ ble Supreme Court India . also mentioned DoP may rely NLEM prepared MOH & FW price fixation . meeting felt opinion/views may taken across country organizing brainstorming regional workshops . However , considering logistics time constraints decided National consultation meet organized Delhi inviting experts various specialties different parts country . Page        Accordingly “ National Consultation Meet Revision National List Essential Medicines ” organized Department Pharmacology , AIIMS & Central Drugs Standard Control Organization ( CDSCO ) , Ministry Health Family Welfare December  -  ,      . meet supported India office . Experts different disciplines medical pharmaceutical institutes , hospitals across country concerned government agencies participated . initial briefing , four groups formed according therapeutic areas . groups asked  specifically give  reasons/evidence  guided  decision regarding addition/deletion/alteration . Subsequently  recommendations  individual groups discussed open house . Thereafter draft recommendations Workshop prepared general consensus . recommendations Workshop deliberated upon Expert Core Committee  th Jan        st Jan      CDSCO . revised NLEM      thus prepared . Expert Core Committee recommended medicines provided various National Health Programmes considered essential medicines . Page         Salient features NLEM      : medicines categorized according therapeutic area . Therefore possible medicine one indication appears one category . issue mentioning strength medicine dose deliberated . committee took considered view strength mentioned NLEM . essentiality requirement medicines categorized follows : - P , denote essentiality Primary , Secondary Tertiary levels respectively P , , ( U NLEM      ) indicates essentiality levels . total     medicines ( excluding repetitions ) present NLEM      . NLEM      ,     medicines fall category P , ,     medicines fall category ,    medicines categorized . comparison NLEM      , number medicines deleted       medicines added . Page          meetings/deliberations core committee/ National consultation meetings held preparing National List Essential Medicines      Core Committee Meetings   . first meeting held CDSCO , FDA Bhawan July    ,        . second meeting held CDSCO , FDA Bhawan January   ,        . third meeting held CDSCO , FDA Bhawan   st Jan,     National Consultation Meetings   . first consultation meet held September    ,      Department Pharmacology , AIIMS , New Delhi   . second National consultation meet held December  -  ,      Department Pharmacology , AIIMS , New Delhi Deliberations :   . dedicated session National Essential Medicine List organized   nd Annual conference Indian Pharmacological Society ,   th December ,      Swabhumi , Kolkata Page               PROCESS ADOPTED REVISION NLEM National List Essential Medicines      ( Base document ) Consultation meetings Experts Deliberation Evidence based criteria addition deletion medicines NLEM Therapeutic area wise group discussion ( Group composition : Clinicians , Pharmacologists , Pharmacists , Scientists Regulators ) REVISION PROCESS contd… Page                      Presentation groups open house discussion Resource Support : Scientists , Senior Residents , Junior Residents PhD Scholar Dept Pharmacology , AIIMS , New Delhi Resource Materials :  Model List Essential Medicines      ,  model formulary ,  National Formulary India      ( Pre print Version ) ,  Textbooks Pharmacology , Internal Medicine ,  Drug compendia ,  Indian Pharmacopoeia ,  Internet facility Deliberations/ discussion reasoning additions/ deletions/modifications Draft recommendations NLEM Consideration adoption NLEM Core Committee Page                         POTENTIAL USES NLEM concept essential medicines , first introduced      , adopted many countries , non-governmental organizations international non-profit supply agencies . list considered include cost-effective medicines particular indication . developed concordance standard treatment guidelines keeping mind healthcare needs majority population . Careful selection limited range essential medicines results higher quality care , better management medicines cost-effective use health resources . list essential medicines guides hospital drug policies , procurement supply medicines public sector , medicine cost reimbursement medicine donations . helps monitoring pricing medicines . list serves reference document correct dosage form strength prescribing . Preference given single drug formulations opposed fixed dose combinations appropriate . Hence use NLEM expected improve prescribing practices well health outcomes . appropriate use medicines selected NLEM promotes rational use medicines . rational use medicines , especially antimicrobial drugs , reduces development drug resistance . list also serves reference assessing healthcare access populace . Lastly , NEML serves tool public education training healthcare providers .
